page.title: 19The Portman Hunt
page.content: Lord Portman's Hunt was sold in 1927 to the Hunt Committee.The Kennels were built in 1889 & are let by the Crown Agents.The Hunt area is{North Dorset. The Committee appoints the Master;he needs 8 horses to hunt the 3 days/week in the season. 45-50 couples are kept. {The Portman Hunt}has between 40-50 who subscribe; half the costs of the Hunt are raised by the Hunt Ball, jumble sales & other fundraising ventures. The present Chairman hunts twice a week in season & keeps 2 horses.It is his chief relaxation. As a farmer he felt it was easier for him perhaps,but the Hunt had members from the Army,the professions & youngsters via the Pony Clubs.He agreed that hunting created controversy.{Saboteurs}were rarely met -there was an episode in Wimborne when the Hunt met there. Controlling foxes mattered. The Hunt created jobs too.
